junitx.framework
Class ThrowableAssert

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--junit.framework.Assert
        |
        +--junitx.framework.Assert
              |
              +--junitx.framework.ThrowableAssert
public class ThrowableAssert
extends Assert

A set of assert methods specially targetted to asserting throwable objects.

Version:
$Revision: #1 $ $Date: 2016/12/14 $
Author:
Vladimir R. Bossicard

Method Detail

assertEquals

public static void assertEquals(java.lang.String message,
                                java.lang.Throwable expected,
                                java.lang.Throwable actual)
Asserts that two throwable objects are equal. Throws an AssertionFailedError if they are equal.

Two throwable objects are considered equals if:

  • their respective classes are the same
  • their respective messages are equal
  • their respective localized messages are equal

assertEquals

public static void assertEquals(java.lang.Throwable expected,
                                java.lang.Throwable actual)
Asserts that two throwable objects are equal. Throws an AssertionFailedError if they are equal.

See Also:
assertEquals(String, Throwable, Throwable)

assertSimilar

public static void assertSimilar(java.lang.String message,
                                 java.lang.Throwable expected,
                                 java.lang.Throwable actual)
Assert that two throwable objects are similar. Throws an AssertionFailedError if they are equal. Two throwable objects are considered similar if:
  • their respective classes are the same
  • the actual object's message or localized message contains the expected object's message

assertSimilar

public static void assertSimilar(java.lang.Throwable expected,
                                 java.lang.Throwable actual)
Assert that two throwable objects are similar. Throws an AssertionFailedError if they are equal.

See Also:
assertSimilar(String, Throwable, Throwable)
